description: On Thursday, Canadian Tire announced it will pay $30 million to take over Hudson's Bays intellectual property, including its famous four stripes motif, various company names, logos, and the retailer's coat-of-arms symbol.
title: Canadian Tire to take over Hudson's Bay's iconic stripes, logos

description: The Weeknd's new movie is not quite a music video, and not quite a movie. Instead, it's arcane, obtuse and boring — a hopelessly pointless therapy assignment serving no one but Abel Tesfaye himself.
title: The Weeknd could've gone to therapy. Instead, he made Hurry Up Tomorrow

description: The RCMP says a 36-year-old man from Toronto has pleaded guilty to two charges in what the force calls the largest terrorism financing scheme in Canada's history.
title: Toronto man pleads guilty to terrorism charges, including financing ISIS, RCMP says

description: U.S. attorneys have filed sentencing submissions for two men convicted after a family froze to death while trying to walk across the Canada-U.S. border in Manitoba in 2022.
title: Prosecutors want 19-year and 10-year sentences for men convicted after family froze at Manitoba border
Live updates: Ford government poised to unveil 2025 Ontario budget

description: The village's pipeline, which connects the water pumping station to the treatment plant, has been frozen since at least March. That has forced the village to drive further out of town to truck in water and have it manually chlorinated, slowing delivery to the community of roughly 2,100 people.
title: Sicknesses spread as Puvirnituq, Que., struggles to restore water flow through frozen pipe

description: Donald Trump wants to accept a Qatari jet to replace ageing Air Force One planes, but the constitutionality of it is disputed. Here are the facts.
title: Trump wants to accept a Qatari jet for Air Force One. Here are the facts

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said Thursday he is dismayed that the new Liberal government has decided to forgo a federal budget for now, saying Prime Minister Mark Carney promised Canadians a plan during the election campaign and he should deliver one sooner rather than later.
title: Poilievre 'very disappointed' in government's decision to skip spring budget

description: Steam user data leak included text messages containing one-time codes sent to users and their phone numbers. Valve says the leak wasn't a result of a data breach of Steam systems, but it's trying to find the source.
title: Were Steam user records leaked? Here's what you need to know

description: The deep cracking sound bursting from within the ice signals the dramatic fall about to happen. Seconds later, a block of ice some 70 metres tall — the size of a 20-storey building — collapses from the face of the Perito Moreno glacier into the aquamarine water below.
title: Tourists watch as a massive chunk of ice breaks off Argentinian glacier

description: R&B singer Cassie was forced under cross-examination Thursday to read aloud explicit messages with her former boyfriend Sean (Diddy) Combs, some of which expressed enthusiasm for sex with other men at Combs's behest that she previously testified she "hated doing."
title: Diddy's lawyers focus on Cassie's texts, try to portray her as willing participant in 'freak-offs'

description: Jada Sampson, 19, tried to save her stranded family by heading out into a blizzard on foot along the remote Trans-Labrador Highway.
title: Labrador woman walks into raging blizzard to find help for her stranded family

description: Canadian chanteuse Céline Dion surprised fans and competitors alike with a message of love and gratitude at this year's Eurovision Song Contest, a competition she says was "life-changing" for her and helped launch her to global superstardom.
title: Celine Dion cheers on Eurovision contest, as fans hope for surprise performance at final

description: A Quebec coroner looking into the death of homeless Innu man, whose body was found inside a portable toilet in Montreal, said his death was attributable to environmental hypothermia in a context of severe alcohol intoxication.
title: Homeless Innu man died of hypothermia. Quebec coroner says system failed him

description: We're back at Superior Court in London, Ont., to bring you the latest updates from the ongoing trial of five former world junior hockey players.
title: Former world junior hockey player back testifying at sex assault trial of ex-teammates

description: Scientists in Australia have identified the oldest known fossil footprints of a reptile-like animal, dated to around 350 million years ago. Previously the earliest known reptile footprints, found in Canada, were dated to 318 million years ago.
title: Oldest fossil footprints from reptile found in Australia

description: The Bloc Québécois is expected to launch a legal challenge against judicial recount that saw the party lose the federal riding of Terrebonne by one vote after a mailing error led to a special ballot not being counted.
title: Bloc Québécois to contest judicial recount in Terrebonne riding: sources

description: More than one in four cars sold worldwide in 2025 will be electric, according to the latest projections from the International Energy Agency, and will reach 40 per cent of all new cars by 2030.
title: 1 in 4 new cars sold in 2025 will be electric, new report says, and China is the undisputed EV leader

description: Cyndie Richards says she was promised change after her son's body went undiscovered in supportive housing for days, but a recent disturbing case reveals serious gaps in the system.
title: Her son's body lay in a supportive housing building for 3 days. Years later, she says little has changed

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin sent aides and deputy ministers to hold peace talks with Ukraine in Turkey on Thursday, spurning Kyiv's challenge to go there in person to meet President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy arrives in Turkey for talks with Russian delegation sent by no-show Putin

description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 60 people in the Gaza Strip on Thursday, Palestinian medics said, as the United States and Arab mediators pushed for a ceasefire deal and U.S. President Donald Trump visited the Middle East.
title: Second night of heavy Israeli bombing kills dozens in Gaza

description: An in-depth look at the sexual assault trial of five former Canadian world junior hockey players, and the larger debate about hockey culture.
title: The latest in the hockey sex assault trial

description: A U.S. fugitive on the run for more than two decades has been arrested in Toronto after living in the city — out in the open — for years, CBC News has learned. Patrick Lutts Jr., a self-styled psychic, faces manslaughter charges in Florida, stemming from a drunk-driving crash that killed two teens.
title: U.S. fugitive arrested in Toronto led double life as 'psychic'
Mapping forever chemicals in Canada: Is there a hotspot near you?
The condo market is slowing down. Where are all the buyers?
Will the Liberals' campaign promises help fix the housing crisis?

description: Canada is planning to have a military training presence in the Arctic up to 10 months a year, the country's military operations commander says. Defence experts say the expanded training regime creates opportunities for NATO allies — who've been largely silent about U.S. President Donald Trump's annexation threats — to demonstrate their support for Canadian sovereignty.
title: Canada's military plans to be in the Arctic 'on a near permanent basis,' says commander

description: It's been 25 years since Walkerton, Ont., made headlines after its water system became contaminated with E. coli in a tragedy that killed seven people and sickened thousands more.
title: 25 years later, Walkerton, Ont., bears the scars but has bounced back

description: Premier Doug Ford's government tables its post-election budget Thursday, as Ontario's export-focused economy confronts the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs. Here's what to watch for.
title: Doug Ford's government drops new Ontario budget today. Here's what to watch for

description: Tony Mastromatteo fought in the Second World War as part of Hamilton-based regiment The Argyll and Sutherland Highlanders of Canada. Regiment historian Robert Fraser says Mastromatteo, who turns 104 this week, is the Argylls’ last known surviving WWII veteran and has a story worth sharing.
title: Last known surviving WWII vet from Hamilton regiment celebrates 104th birthday

description: A group of tenants on Montreal's South Shore are accusing their new landlord of pushing them to leave their apartments and they say his behaviour is evidence of a business model that makes money at the expense of low-income, vulnerable people.
title: These Châteauguay, Que., tenants say their landlord is cashing in by pushing them out

description: As a Pakistani, Zahra Khozema was brought up to see Indians as the enemy. After her family immigrated to Canada, she realized the two countries had more in common than she was led to believe and she began to see beyond the propaganda of hate.
title: What growing up Pakistani taught me about India and how those feelings changed in Canada

description: When Kanye West's new song praising Adolf Hitler was posted on a number of social media platforms, most tech companies removed the antisemitic track from their sites. But some experts say these companies are not doing enough to prevent the posting of online hate content.
title: Ye's song praising Hitler was pulled from most online platforms. Are they doing enough?
